This is an amazing life simulation game that really feels like you're taking part in, and leading, someone and really being that person. The animation system is absolutely fantastic, besides some bad animation transition, the character interaction is complex and unique and the game as a whole is extremely well done. The AI is a bit stupid and not very good but I can excuse that for how good the rest of this game is. The characted customization is the best I've ever seen, besides maybe Black Dessert Online, with in depth characted facial construction and amazing clothing customization, with the option of creating your own clothing. The only fault is the lack of hair-styles, facial hair, hats and the really crappy body hair and tattoo options but those can be excused.The ConclusionThis game is a fantastic game with many flaws but I would no doubt recommend this to anyone looking for a good simulation game to throw on to waste some time. Not to mention it's one of the good EA games that are on Steam so there's a major plus.The VerdictPort - 7.5/10Graphics - 6/10Performance - 3.5/10Story - *no rating*/10Atmosphere - 9.5/10Characters - *no rating*/10Controls - 8/10Gameplay - 10/10AI - 6.5/10Average Rating - 7/10Actual Rating - 9/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
er 24, 2013
												I've been enjoying the Sims ever since I was little kid.  The Sims 3 pretty much completes the franchise for me.  Keep in mind that EA is going to try to swindle you for every penny that you have but 95% of additional purchases outside of the expansions aren't worth it.  Also, at this current point in time, you might want to weigh your options.  Sims 3 is pretty much "completed", however unless there is a sale going on either on Steam or Origin, you're probably going to be spending way too much money on this game.  Sims 4 will be coming out soon but other than little gimmicks it doesn't seem to be too different from 3.  So you should probably choose one or the other.  Sims 3 itself is very enjoyable once you get past all of EA's tricks.  This is a casual game.  Keep that in mind.  There's a ton of stuff to do and I find it very relaxing to create Sims and pack my towns with custom made families and stories.  There's all sorts of mods by talented creators as well.  Sims 3, alone, is not all that great.  Sims 3 with all of the ep's is fantastic.  However, with all of the money you'll spend on the Sims 3 (probably) you may not ever want to buy another Sims game for a long time.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
, 2016
												The Sims 3 is the next sensible step of development for the The Sims series, namely the open world feature. It's a great concept, but some people may find this game incredibly laggy. I personally haven't had issues with it, maybe the occasional crash, but other users have reported serious lag. All I can say is check the specs; don't chance it is doesn't meet minimum requirements. The Sim customisation and traits is great and adds a lot to the gameplay, but I've always found that the Sims look a bit weird, and the game has lost some of its charm compared to The Sims 2. Not to mention, EA love a good cash grab, so the normal price is a bit steep- definitely grab it when it's on sale. Also another to keep an eye out for is the Story Progession is broken. You can get mods, and I'd recommend NRaas' mods, but there's a chance it can seriously slow the game down. Overall, I've never had any problems with this game, but definitely get it cheap.

y 1, 2015
												I got the university life and late night expansions for this game and in the future I may buy more, tbh this game is amazing, I know I am writing this review after the release of sims 4 but really, sims 3 is so much better, the sims 4 had a total of 86 features that were in sims 3 left out of sims 4o because... reasons, sims 4 seems and looks unfinished to me, sims 3 on the other hand is amazing, allowing you to create your sim, have them move freely around the town without the loading screen that is present when going from place to place in the sims 4, yes in the sims 3 none of that ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t exists, the full town is loaded at all times :D, the game is really fun and really silly. I made sims of me and a couple of my friends and sent them to university, one of them flirts with everyone, two others keep fighting of the maid and then the other two just exist, overall I highly recommend this game

												Its a clever quirky game (even though its made by the kings of game bandits)This games good for-Making the you who you've wished to be forever!-Dating Girls You dont have the courage to talk to in real life-Buying Sim Life Goggles (AKA Oculus Rift) Which you problably cant afford irl-Wearing nice Clothes-Spending twenty dollars each Dlc- wait what?!?! Thats The Same Price as the Game!!!!-Having kids (that if you were an adult you wish you had)-Watching Little You's take a shower or go Use the toilet-Cheating for money, I mean How is one to buy a car without Cheats?-talking to your murdered- I-I-Mean Passed Away Loved Ones, who now are ghostsAnd The best is-Luring a guest into a room With Nothing in it and removing the doorBut Really Its a fun game... 8/10 Would Murder More Sims Again
